{"step_by_step_thinking": "Etanercept is a disease-modifying drug used in the management of rheumatoid arthritis. To determine its mechanism of action, we need to consider the pathophysiology of rheumatoid arthritis. Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disease characterized by chronic inflammation of the joints. One of the key cytokines involved in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis is TNF alpha. Therefore, the mechanism of action of Etanercept is likely to involve the inhibition of TNF alpha, as it is a TNF alpha inhibitor.", "answer_choice": "A"}
